verses.roman:
tam apṛcchad dhṛṣīkeśaḥ
kiṁ te dṛṣṭam ivādbhutam
bhūmau viyati toye vā
tathā tvāṁ lakṣayāmahe

synonyms: tam—of him; apṛcchat—asked; hṛṣīkśaḥ—Lord Kṛṣṇa; kim—whether; te—by you; dṛṣṭam—seen; iva—indeed; adbhutam—something exceptional; bhūmau—on the earth; viyati—in the sky; toye—in the water; va—or; tathā—so; tvām—you; lakṣayāmahe—We surmise.
translation: Lord Kṛṣṇa asked Akrūra: Have you seen something wonderful on the earth, in the sky or in the water? From your appearance, We think you have.
